bill.title: Commission on Reform and Modernization of the Department of State Act Intragovernmental Cybersecurity and Counterintelligence Information Sharing Act Daniel Anderl Judicial Security and Privacy Act of 2022 FedRAMP Authorization Act Burma Unified through Rigorous Military Accountability Act of 2022 Financial Data Transparency Act of 2022 Global Health Security and International Pandemic Prevention, Preparedness and Response Act of 2022 Global Catastrophic Risk Management Act of 2022 DHS Joint Task Forces Reauthorization Act of 2022 Access to Congressionally Mandated Reports Act Iran Nuclear Weapons Capability and Terrorism Monitoring Act of 2022 FENTANYL Results Act Otto Warmbier Countering North Korean Censorship and Surveillance Act of 2022 Fighting Emerging Narcotics Through Additional Nations to Yield Lasting Results Act BURMA Act of 2022 United States-Ecuador Partnership Act of 2022 Transnational Criminal Investigative Unit Stipend Act Strategic EV Management Act of 2022 Diplomatic Support and Security Act of 2022 Secure Embassy Construction and Counterterrorism Act of 2022 Military to Mariners Act of 2022 Department of State Authorization Act of 2022 Don Young Coast Guard Authorization Act of 2022 Water Resources Development Act of 2022 Technological Hazards Preparedness and Training Act of 2022 Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023 Advancing American AI Act Ukraine Invasion War Crimes Deterrence and Accountability Act Securing Inspector General Independence Act of 2022 PLUM Act of 2022 Military Construction Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023 United States-Taiwan Public Health Protection Act Periodically Listing Updates to Management Act of 2022 Taiwan Fellowship Act Performance Enhancement Reform Act Taiwan Enhanced Resilience Act Integrity Committee Transparency Act of 2022 21st Century Assistive Technology Act
bill.description: To provide for improvements to the rivers and harbors of the United States, to provide for the conservation and development of water and related resources, and for other purposes.

referrals.name: Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment

history.action: Introduced in House
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment.
Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure. H. Rept. 117-347.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 261.
Mr. DeFazio moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H5262-5296)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7776.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H5402)
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 384 - 37 (Roll no. 253). (text: 06/07/2022 CR H5262-5289)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 399.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent. (consideration: CR S3756-3761)
Passed Senate, under the order of 7/20/2022, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, with an amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 93 - 1. Record Vote Number: 273. (text: CR S3756)
S.Amdt.5140 Amendment SA 5140 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
S.Amdt.5140 Amendment SA 5140 proposed by Senator Carper. (consideration: CR S3756; text: CR S3756)
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Resolving differences -- House actions: Pursuant to the provisions of H.Res. 1512, the House agreed to the Senate amendment with an amendment.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Con. Res. 121, enrollment corrections on H.R. 7776 have been made.
Pursuant to the provisions of H.Res. 1512, the House agreed to the Senate amendment with an amendment.
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate amendment.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent. (consideration: CR S7148)
Motion by Senator Schumer to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 7776 made in Senate. (CR S7148)
Motion by Senator Schumer to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 7776 with an amendment (SA 6513) made in Senate. (CR S7148)
S.Amdt.6518 Amendment SA 6518 proposed by Senator Schumer to Amendment SA 6517. To modify the effective date.
S.Amdt.6517 Amendment SA 6517 proposed by Senator Schumer to Amendment SA 6516 (the instructions of the motion to refer). To modify the effective date.
S.Amdt.6516 Amendment SA 6516 proposed by Senator Schumer. To add an effective date.
S.Amdt.6515 Amendment SA 6515 proposed by Senator Schumer to Amendment SA 6513. To add an effective date.
S.Amdt.6513 Amendment SA 6513 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Manchin. To provide for American energy security by improving the permitting process.

Motion by Senator Schumer to refer to Senate Committee on Armed Services the House message to accompany H.R. 7776 with instructions to report back forthwith with the following amendment (SA 6516) made in Senate.
Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S7184-7185)
Cloture motion on the motion to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 7776 with an amendment SA 6513 presented in Senate.
S.Amdt.6513 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered).
S.Amdt.6515 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered).
S.Amdt.6518 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered).
S.Amdt.6517 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered).
S.Amdt.6516 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered).
Cloture motion on the motion to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 7776 presented in Senate.
Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S7213-7219, S7226-7237)
Motion by Senator Sullivan to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 7776 with an amendment (SA 6522) made in Senate. (CR S7227)
Motion by Senator Sullivan to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 7776 with an amendment (SA 6522) withdrawn by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S7227-7230)

Motion by Senator Schumer to refer to Senate Committee on Armed Services the House message to accompany H.R. 7776 with instructions to report back forthwith with the following amendment (SA 6516) withdrawn in Senate by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S7213)
Cloture on the motion by Senator Schumer to concur in the House Amendment to H.R. 7776 with an amendment (SA 6513), cloture not invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 47. Record Vote Number: 394.
Schumer motion to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 7776 with an amendment SA 6513 withdrawn by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S7230-7233)
Motion by Senator Johnson to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 7776 with an amendment (SA 6526) made in Senate. (CR S7233)

Motion by Senator Johnson to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 7776 with an amendment (SA 6526) under the order of 12/15/22, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to by Yea-Nay Vote. 40 - 54. Record Vote Number: 395.

Resolving differences -- Senate actions: Senate agreed, under the order of 12/15/22, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 7776 by Yea-Nay Vote. 83 - 11. Record Vote Number: 396.
S.Amdt.6518 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S7213)
S.Amdt.6517 SA 6517 fell when SA 6516 was withdrawn.
S.Amdt.6518 SA 6518 fell when SA 6517 fell.
S.Amdt.6517 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S7213)

S.Amdt.6526 Amendment SA 6526 proposed by Senator Johnson. (consideration: CR S7233-7234; text: CR S7233) To provide remedies to members of the Armed Forces discharged or subject to punishment under the COVID-19 vaccine mandate.
S.Amdt.6522 Amendment SA 6522 proposed by Senator Sullivan. (consideration: CR S7227-7230; text: CR S7227) To amend the Camp Lejeune Justice Act of 2022 to appropriately limit attorney's fees.
S.Amdt.6516 Proposed amendment SA 6516 withdrawn in Senate.
S.Amdt.6522 Proposed amendment SA 6522 withdrawn in Senate.
S.Amdt.6526 Amendment SA 6526, under the order of 12/15/22, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 40 - 54. Record Vote Number: 395.
S.Amdt.6515 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S7213)
S.Amdt.6516 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S7213)
S.Amdt.6513 Proposed amendment SA 6513 withdrawn in Senate.
S.Amdt.6513 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S7230-7233)
S.Amdt.6515 SA 6515 fell when when the motion to concur in the House amendment to H.R. 7776 with an amendment SA 6513 was withdrawn.
Senate agreed, under the order of 12/15/22, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 7776 by Yea-Nay Vote. 83 - 11. Record Vote Number: 396.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 117-263.

votes.desc: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended
Passed Senate, under the order of 7/20/2022, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, with an amendment

calendar.description: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure Hearing
